Review: The placements here at IIT Kharagpur are strong, but if you're in the agriculture and food engineering department, you can have a hard time being hired if you don't have industry-relevant abilities to go along with your academic credentials. The majority of Indian agriculture-based companies are unaware that such a department exists at an IIT. IIT Kharagpur is the only IIT with a department of agricultural and food engineering. As a result, most businesses are unaware of it. Students are put in roughly 40-45 percent of the time. Companies prioritize M.Tech/dual degree students above B.Tech students. The highest offered wage was 40 LPA (international), while the lowest was 3 LPA. The department's average pay is 7 LPA, which is the same as the college placement average.

We got the exams scheduled at the beginning of the semester and the exams are very time-bounded if one is attending class on daily basis, can easily pass the exams.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: "LIVE LOVE MCC"
Review: MCC is very famous for its inter-collegiate function "DEEPWOODS". MCC is also famous for its inter-collegiate dance competition followed by a musical showdown "UTSAV" organized by ST. Name: lakshmi
Heading: Best college in telangana

Name: Aman Pawar
College: Mangalmay Institute of Management and Technology - [MIMT]

Academic and educational organization, media and publication organization, student government organization, etc type of social group and college infrastructure is so good.

Name: Akhil Verma

Name: Rahul Negi
College: IIT Roorkee - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITR]

The college fest named Thomso is a 3-day event that includes DJ Night, Dancing performance and many celebrity singers are invited to the campus for performance. In the technical fest of the college, many renowned colleges of India participate in the fest. The college library is the collection of Databases, Books, and national and international journals. The library is heaven for book readers. The classrooms are big and spacious.

Name: Rahul Moga
College: IIT Bombay - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITB]
Heading: IIT Bombay Review
Review: The college has one of the best placements in India. The placement committee of the college is well aware of the companies and students' requirements and interests and the committee prepare us accordingly. For our batch, the highest placement package went up to 65 LPA and the average placement package was around 17.50 LPA. Few students were very fortunate to receive pre-placement offers. Companies like Uber, Ruberik, Millennium, Black Stone, Barclays, CITI Bank, Delloite, Accenture, EY, PwC, Infosys, Samsung, Amway, Wipro, Loreal, Marico, etc visited our campus for placement drive in the college.

Name: Yash
Heading: Absolutely satisfied because of college faculty and environment.

I choose this course because I wanted to become a programmer so I opted for this course.
Faculty: student ratio is about 1:5 and the behavior of faculty is very good and helpful.
The faculty members are well qualified and their teaching method is also good.
There are 2 mid-terms during a semester and it is not so hard to pass the exams you just need to attend classes to pass the exam.

Name: Tushar
College: Arya College of Engineering and IT - [ACEIT]
Heading: College Review
Review:
They conduct a kind of party for the refreshment of students at the end of the month.. mostly every month..In our library, there are various books for different fields they provide two days for sports every week..but there is no proper coach or they do not perform extra activities professionally.
There are no clubs which are required. They are good at providing academic facilities but not extracurricular activities.

Name: Subroto Mukherjee
Heading: "Internships are given, but not yet detailed about"
Review:
Lots of numerous groups are there which are all led by chairpersons respective to each club individually, there are various kinds such as dance, cycling, event organizing, chess, research, science, space, astronomy club, etc and various others.

Life at the campus is surely a unique experience. From waking up to the extreme colds at 15-17° in the morning, from walking back from dinner in that same temperature, it becomes warmer when the sun is shining, but that's the only time it's pleasant, however, depending on the perspective you can call it cold or pleasant.
There is an issue, which is, the college the hostel and our appointed canteen are all 15-20 mins walking away at least, which eventually becomes inconvenient every time to walk that far every time. Especially during lunchtimes and early breakfast to college times.
Availability of books is not limited exactly even though the libraries are smaller sorta, a shelf filled in the staffroom, regardless it's completed with all necessary needs.

Name: Rahul Thapa
Heading: Everything about VIVA College for BSc(IT)
Review:
There is an annual fest in which you will have a lot of events and games.
For example, human chess, painting, dancing, singing, and so on.
It is conducted in NEW VIVA Campus and organized by the VIVA Student council committee.
They do a good job while organizing the event. 
It is usually for 7 days and on the 7th day, there is a Dj night party.
The library is very good in NEW VIVA, with plenty of books to choose from your course and other fields that you are interested in.
You also get free wifi in the library with computer facilities and a stationary shop.
There is no special amenity in the classroom, it's just an old classroom with lights and fans and some crooked-up benches to sit on.
There are a lot of sports facilities in New viva college gymkhana.
There are a lot of extracurricular activities but sadly I was not a part of any of them.
There is only one student body that handles everything regarding fest and events which is VIVA STUDENT COUNCIL. 
They have an Instagram page.

Name: Sai manaswini
Heading: For me I had learnt a lot from my college.but What ever the college is student mentality matters.
Review:
We will be given placement assistance from starting of the third year itself. Every topic which is required to attempt the company exams will be given training. Some external organizations will be coming to college for providing students with the training.
There will be only some on-campus drives. But no need to worry because these days large MNCs are recruiting students in bulk by conducting national-wide off-campus exams irrespective of their colleges. If we utilize the training provided by college it will be really helpful and easy to crack those exams.

College TPO is very friendly. sometimes he'll be harsh to students if the situations and behavior of students are out of control.
In my batch i.e.,2018-22 batch 162 students got a place in just their 6th semester as of now. How cool it is. The last batch, it is a 60% conversion rate. But this time before completing the course I'm seeing that rate.

Name: Bhavya sapra

Name: ananya agarwal

Our college is known for winning in competitions held nationwide.

Name: Nikhil

My plan is to work in a job for at least 2 years and then do higher studies in my field.

Name: Shailen Sharma

Name: Santosh James

1:70 is the faculty-student ratio for a class.

Coming to end-term exams, it's all MCQ types and the 2-minute timer is there for each question.
The level of questions mostly is Moderate.

Name: Rishika
College: Shaheed Rajguru College of Applied Sciences for Women
Heading: AN HONEST LOOK
Review:

Their teaching skill is very well as they love to evaluate and explore things with students.
Teachers take exams after completing the unit or after completing half the unit approximately You have to have to give a maximum of 2 tests in a month for each subject. Coming on difficulty level, teachers always choose a level between medium to high

Name: Sahil
Heading: HBTU's Intership Goals
Review:
Harcourt Butler Technical University (HBTU), Kanpur has an active placement cell. The institute successfully conducted its 2021 placement drive. The students achieved good CTC packages during HBTU Placements 2021. 63.61% of the total students in the participating batch were placed during the placement drive. A total of 437 students were eligible to participate in the placement process. They received 278 placement offers from the recruiting companies.

The interim report of HBTU Placements 2021 is released. According to the report, the students received the highest CTC of INR 43.5 LPA. The average CTC stood at INR 6.46 LPA.

Every year, recruiters like ITC, Dabur, IBM, HSBC, Berger Paints, Bharat Petroleum, Finserv, British Paints, etc participate in the HBTU Placements.

The highest package offered was 40LPA, and the lowest package is offered from mass recruiters like Infosys, TCS, etc. The average salary is about 7-8 LPA, and all the dream companies like Amazon, Flipkart, Microsoft, Samsung, visit our campus for placements.

Name: Yukta Singh

Per semester we have 3 exams 2 mid sems and one end sem. And the level of the exams is moderate.

Name: Sidharth Kumar

Review:

This course also helps in higher studies and in many entrance examinations(like NET, IIT JAM, CSIR), etc.

The overall faculty and teaching staff is good. However, the faculty is not as same as of Scholl Faculty. Obviously,there should be difference. So, you have to prepare yourself for all examinations. No, Teacher will help you that much.

1st year has: 8 Subjects(4 subjects in each semester)
2nd year has 10 subjects (5 in each semester)
3rd year has 8 subjects(4 in each semester)

Therefore, in total we have 26 subjects.

Name: Student (Anonymous)

Name: Geetika Kaushik

Currently, I have studied only through the online mode and hence it is difficult to comment on the teaching process. There is a Midterm exam and End term exam at the end of the semester, regular quizzes and assignments are also conducted. Based on all these things, GPA is calculated. One needs to study in a focused manner to pass the exams with good marks, however at the same time participate in extracurricular activities and enhance your skillset.

The faculty No's are not more but the quality is good. Our programming faculty was a BITs Pilani star faculty and our MATHS faculty is an IIT K Ph.D. holder.
